Detailed Description

All Printing Notifications.

Callbacks defined within ICPrinterDelegate protocol than can be implemented by the delegate of ICPrinter.

Function Documentation

- (void) printingDidEndWithRowNumber: (NSUInteger)  count

This method is triggered when the ICPrinter object has received all the data needed for printing a receipt.

Each pixel of the receipt is encoded using one bit of data, and the number of rows is given by the count parameter. The width of the graphics to be rendred is then equal to 8 times the size of the received data divided by the number of rows. Please note that this callback should be used separately of the receivedPrinterData: callback (must not be implementing if you use this one).

Parameters
countThe number of rows of the receipt to be printed
- (void) receivedPrinterData: (NSData *)  data

This method is called every time the printer channel receives data from the Companion.

All the data passed through calls to receivedPrinterData must be buffered until a printingDidEndWithRowNumber call is performed. The receiver should then generate the receipt using the data it gathered so far.

Parameters
dataA NSData containing a set of line dots to be printed.
- (void) receivedPrinterData: (NSData *)  data
numberOfLines: (NSInteger)  count 

This method is called every time the printer channel receives data from the Companion.

The application should bufferize the data and print it sequencially. This callback provides the number of received lines since it is meant to be used when the end of printing is not known in advance.
Please note that this callback should be used separately of the printingDidEndWithRowNumber: callback (must not be implementing if you use this one).

Parameters
dataA NSData containing a set of line dots to be printed.
countThe number of printed lines contained within data
